nodes.name: Machine Learning
nodes.description: A field of study that gives computers the ability to learn without being explicitly programmed.

nodes.name: Neural Networks
nodes.description: Computing systems inspired by biological neural networks in human brains.

nodes.name: Deep Learning
nodes.description: A subset of machine learning based on artificial neural networks with multiple layers.

nodes.name: Supervised Learning
nodes.description: A type of machine learning where the model is trained on labeled data.

1: What is the difference between machine learning and traditional programming?
What are the main types of machine learning?
2: What are the basic components of a neural network?
What are the different types of neural networks?
3: What makes deep learning different from traditional neural networks?
What are the applications of deep learning?
What are the challenges in deep learning?
4: What are the advantages of supervised learning?
What types of problems can supervised learning solve?
How do you evaluate a supervised learning model?

1.text: Machine learning is the study of computer algorithms that can improve automatically through experience.

2.text: Neural networks are computing systems inspired by the biological neural networks that constitute animal brains.
2.source: Goodfellow, I., Bengio, Y., & Courville, A. (2016). Deep Learning

1.title: Email Spam Detection
1.description: Using machine learning to classify emails as spam or not spam.

2.title: Image Recognition with Neural Networks
2.description: Building a neural network to recognize handwritten digits.
